snippet: Prosecutors give absurd reasons to exclude black people from serving on juries.
abstract: Op-Ed article by former United States Deputy Atty Gen Larry D Thompson asserts black jurors are routinely excluded from jury selection throughout United States, and particularly in South, despite more than century of attempted legislative and judicial remedies; holds Supreme Court case Foster v Chapman provides clear evidence of exclusionary tactics; says failure to establish discrimination in case bodes poorly for effort overall.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors give absurd reasons to exclude black people from serving on juries.

headline.main: How America Tolerates Racism in Jury Selection
